English: to go to a sports club
to go downhill with a sled
to be afraid of the dark
I was born in Irak / Russia.
I lived in Afghanistan as a child.
I spent my childhood in Namibia.
I was really quiet as a child.
I was overactive when I was a child.
I was good at school as a child.
I played a lot of soccer as a child.
I have a big brother and a younger sister.
hungarian: Van egy bátyám és egy húgom.

English: I don't remember much from my childhood.
I played soccer when I was a child.
I played outside a lot when I was a child.
I played with my younger brother as a child.
As a child I played almost always with dolls.
I had a lot of toys as a child.
I biked a lot when I was small.
I visited my grandparents every weekend.
I loved puzzles when I was a child.

Finnish: Olin isän tyttö, kun olin pieni.
English: I was daddy's girl when I was small.
I had a lot of friends when I was a child.
We often played hide and seek.
We had a playhouse in the yard.

Finnish: Minulla on yksi lapsi / tyttö / poika.
English: I have one child / daughter / son.

Finnish: Minulla on yksi poika ja kaksi tyttöä.
English: I have one son and two daughters.
hungarian: Van egy fiúm és két lányom.

Finnish: Minulla on kaksi poikaa ja neljä tyttöä.
English: I have two sons and four daughters.
hungarian: Két fiú és négy lányom van.

English: My child is five years old.
My child is already grown up.
My children are already grown up.
My child is in day care.
My child is in first grade.
My child is a first grader.
My child is in second grade.
My child goes to school already.
My child likes to go to school.
My child doesn't like to go to school.
hungarian: A gyerekem nem szeret iskolába járni.

English: My child will soon start school.
My child goes to an English-speaking day care center.
My child is doing well in Finnish school.
hungarian: A gyerekem jól tanul egy finn nyelvű iskolában.

English: My child has “Finnish as a second language” classes.
I help my child with homework.
hungarian: Segítek a gyerekemnek a házi feladatban.

English: I can't help my child with homework.
hungarian: Nem tudok segíteni a gyerekemnek a házi feladatban.

Finnish: Lapseni puhuu jo jonkin verran suomea.
English: My child already speaks some Finnish.
hungarian: A gyerekem már beszél valamennyire finnül.

Finnish: Lapseni osaa puhua suomea paremmin kuin minä.
English: My child can speak Finnish better than I can.
hungarian: A gyerekem jobban tud finnül, mint én.

Finnish: Lapseni oppii suomea nopeammin kuin minä.
English: My child is learning Finnish faster than I am.
hungarian: A gyerekem gyorsabban tanul finnül, mint én.

English: I speak my native language with my child at home.
My husband speaks Finnish with the children.
hungarian: A férjem finnül beszél a gyerekekkel.

English: My child is growing like crazy.
My child already knows how to walk.
My child is learning how to walk.
My child's milk teeth are starting to fall out.
I play soccer with my child.
My child plays with the neighbor's children.
hungarian: A gyerekem a szomszéd gyerekeivel játszik.

English: My child knows how to swim already.
My child knows how to ski and ice skate.
I take my child to football training every week.
hungarian: Minden héten elviszem a gyerekeimet fociedzésre.

Finnish: Lapseni juoksee ja kiipeää koko ajan.
English: My child runs and climbs all the time.
hungarian: A gyerekem folyamatosan fut és mászik.

English: My child's favorite food is macaroni casserole.
hungarian: Gyermekem kedvenc étele egy doboz makaróni.

English: My child's favorite toy is a fire truck.
My child likes to play in the sandbox.
My child would like a pet.
My child is allergic to nuts.

Finnish: Lapseni on allerginen kissoille ja koirille.
English: My child is allergic to cats and dogs.
My child has too many toys.
hungarian: A gyerekemnek túl sok játéka van.

English: My child eats too much candy.
hungarian: A gyerekem túl sok édességet eszik.

English: I try to read bedtime stories to my child.
hungarian: Próbálok esti mesét olvasni a gyerekemnek.

English: Before bedtime we read bedtime stories.
My child's favorite school subject is PE.
My child's bedtime is at 7 pm.
How did it go in school today?
Let's play house! Come play with me / us.
Oh no, did you get hurt? (children's language)

hungarian: Add ide, amíg anya fújja a pipát.

English: Do you need help with homework?
hungarian: Segítségre van szüksége a házi feladathoz?

English: Have you done your homework already?
